ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Reading, writing, listening, speaking skills of Japanese language

I learned the hiragana and katakana alphabets of the Japanese language, as well as several kanji characters. I also learned a fair amount of conversational Japanese. I developed skills in accountability as this was the only class I had that met every day.
Learned the basic foundations of the Japanese language.
intro to Japanese
I really develop my Japanese skills in different aspect.
I had a good introduction to Japanese and would be able to express myself in many commonly occurring contexts.

I learned much more than I expected in terms of grammar, vocabulary, and kanji (as well as hiragana and katakana). I also learned that Japanese is much more intricate that I thought, having different ways oF demonstrating one's relationship with the listener.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It's very rigorous and has many assignments throughout the week, which may be difficult to get a hold of in the beginning.

Strengths of the course include the enthusiasm of the teachers, the high involvement of the students in the lessons, and the visual aids. However, the course moved a bit quickly and became quite challenging after lesson 9; being more methodical in explanation of lesson 9 and onwards could benefit the course overall.
Various ways of teaching were a strength. Could be improved by having more partner activities.
It's a great class and has a lot of interactions to practice Japanese.
Everything is great!
The course was very well taught and the teachers focused a lot on making sure that the students were able to practice the material learned sufficiently.
I would like to have them work out grammar on the board. I had trouble retaining the grammar rules when it was only on the presentation slides.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if the student is very passionate about learning Japanese. The course is very in-depth but moves a bit quickly. If the student is willing to put the effort in, I would highly recommend the course.
Yes, great way to learn the basics of another language.
Absolutely.
Yes, I would. It is a good way to learn a new language.

I would recommend this course to any student who would is genuinely interested in learning Japanese. As long as you have the time and motivation to learn the material, you will greatly enjoy this course.
I recommend it to anyone who is truly interested in learning Japanese. It's a heavy workload and mental/time commitment, but it's manageable and a lively, engaging class.
